Article CARDINAL of LAW provides for judicial review of decisions , acts or inaction on the part of an inquirer , investigator or prosecutor which affect constitutional rights or freedoms . The judge is empowered to verify the lawfulness and reasonableness of the decision , act or inaction and to grant the following forms of relief : ( i ) to declare the impugned decision , act or inaction unlawful or unreasonable and to order the authority concerned to remedy the violation ; or ( ii ) to dismiss the complaint .

CARDINAL . In its ORG of CARDINAL DATE ORG of GPE stated that it was incumbent on judges DATE before processing an LAW complaint – to establish whether the preliminary investigation had been completed in the main case ( point CARDINAL ) . If the main case has already been sent for trial or the investigation completed , the complaint should not be examined unless it has been brought either by a person who is not a party to the main case or DATE if such a complaint is not amenable to judicial review under LAW at the pre - trial stage of the proceedings . In all other situations the complaint under LAW should be left unexamined and the complainant should be informed that he or she can raise the matter before the trial or appeal courts in the main case .

CARDINAL . Similarly , according to ORG construction , a complaint under LAW can not be brought or pursued after the criminal case to which the complaint is connected has been submitted for trial . However , where it is established that a party to the proceedings ( including a judge or a witness ) has committed a criminal offence , thus seriously compromising the fairness of the proceedings , the LAW exceptionally allows for separate investigation of the relevant circumstances , leading to a reopening of the case ( see Decision no .
